title.rendered: Part-Time Jobs for College Students During COVID-19

content.rendered:
Looking for paid summer part-time jobs in your area?

This list of jobs was compiled to offer suggestions for students who are in search of a summer job or have an internship on hold. If you’re looking for part-time summer work as a college student amidst COVID-19, check out the following list.

Handshake is here to help during COVID-19. Discover employers hiring now, and access other resources to help you during this time.

The following positions are great options for those seeking ways to supplement their income while facing a tough online job market–ranked from highest to lowest paying.

Remote Data Entry

What you would do: You’d update and enter data to various documents and notes for a company’s specific needs. This could be a great way to earn from home while keeping your schedule flexible.

Hourly pay: $16.74

Medical Transcriptionist

What you would do: You’d listen to recordings from medical workers and transcribe them into written reports to help those in medical professions.

Hourly pay: $16.05

Amazon (Shopper, Driver, Warehouse Assistant)

What you would do: Amazon is currently hiring for three different positions: you could apply to shop people’s groceries, deliver their packages, or work in their warehouses depending on what role you’d be a good fit for.

Hourly pay: $15.00

Grocery Store Stocker

What you would do: There is high demand right now for workers that keep necessities stocked at the store. You might be cleaning up, stocking supplies, and generally helping keep everything clean and organized.

Hourly pay: $14.26

DoorDash Delivery Driver

What you would do: Since not many people feel safe leaving their houses for food and supplies, you’d be providing them a fast and safe way to receive delivery orders.

Hourly pay: $14.24

Bank Teller

What you would do: Banks count on detail oriented individuals to help keep track of routine transactions.

Hourly pay: $14.16

Cashier

What you would do: Essential stores like pharmacies, hardware stores, and markets are in need of extra workers to be cashiers/team members. You’d help with stocking, checking people out, or possibly delivering essential items to customers.

Hourly pay: $11.37

excerpt.rendered: Having trouble finding part-time summer jobs? Check out this list of open roles.
